articles.title: Japanese prime minister to go ahead with Mideast Visit
articles.description: Japan's prime minister will go ahead with a planned visit to the Middle East despite the crisis following an Iranian missile attack on U.S. troops and the U.S. drone strike that killed an Iranian Revolutionary Guard general
articles.content:
Prime Minister Shinzo Abe will visit Saudi Arabia, the United Arab Emirates and Oman from Jan. 11 to 15, Chief Cabinet Secretary Yoshihide Suga told reporters.
In this visit, as the situation in the Middle East increases in tension, we will exchange views wi… [+786 chars]

articles.title: Suspected Chinese meddling focus in Taiwan presidential vote

articles.content:
China claims Taiwan as its own, if necessary to be taken by force, and its alleged meddling is a hot issue in the race between incumbent President Tsai Ing-wen and Nationalist candidate Han Kuo-yu, the populist mayor of Kaohsiung city.

articles.title: Libya's war could be a snapshot of the 21st century's new normal
articles.description: The strategic mess in Libya smacks of an earlier era, when foreign powers jostled for influence in resource-rich lands consumed by political turmoil. But that's a reflection of our present, too.
articles.content: Since April, the forces of renegade Gen. Khalifa Hifter have pursued a withering offensive on the environs of the capital, Tripoli, locked in a battle of attrition with militias loyal to the U.N.-recognized Government of National Accord. More than a half-year… [+5660 chars]
